profile_positions.title: Software Engineer 2

profile_positions.description: Frontend Engineer on Outlook web, React and Typescript
profile_positions.title: Software Engineer 2

profile_positions.description:
instaleap.io is a SAS platform that automates the last-mile logistics grocery delivery process.

I had the opportunity to be part of the team that started the platform and I was given the responsibility of leading a team of (initially) 3 developers including myself. 

Our team had the responsibility of delivering the order management system (OMS) that had all the business logic for the order life cycle, including change of status, assign and informing who were responsible for each order, cancellation policy, among many others.

After just 9 months of starting the platform and 3 months of being in operation, our OMS have managed +3k orders from retailers on three different countries and that number is increasing each day.

The value I considered I added to the team has the following main components.

- Software Design: I helped the team to architect the system and more importantly, evolve the initial design, refactor and iterate over it so that it would support the new coming requirements by making design meetings and important design decisions. 

- Software Quality: I helped the team to achieve high quality code, focusing on testability, readability and performance by introducing the practice of code review, continuous refactoring, cleaning and testing.

- Requirements Specification: I helped the product management team to define the required effort to implement certain requirements so that we could agree on a plan to implement the most valuable features given the time constraints.

- Mentorship: I decided who implemented some features or requirements and I did that following the mindset of helping a developer grow by increasing the difficulty of the tasks progressively. Also, guide new comers to get involved quickly in the project, learn and increase their skill set.   

 We implemented the system using Typescript, NodeJS and PostgreSQL
profile_positions.title: Software Engineer Technical Lead

profile_positions.description:
I was part of a team that maintained several systems of mercadoni.com (before it went out of business). Those systems were distributed systems that followed a service oriented architecture.

Main effort:
We had the problem of not knowing the true logic behind the payment scheme, as the payment service was a true legacy system and the responsibility was shared between many services so,
- I Designed and Implemented part of a new payment flow that would centralize the payment logic in just one service, solving the issue of not knowing why the payments were the way they were but more importantly, being able to easily adapt the payment rules to future necessities.

Maintenance effort:
- Fixed several bugs on the logistics and payment services.
- Recover the application from crashes of legacy systems and make temporary patches to keep them working.

The systems were mainly written in JavaScript with NodeJS and a mixture of MongoDB and PostgreSQL as databases.
profile_positions.title: Software Development Engineer

profile_positions.description:
- Full Stack Software Engineer, member of UNCode (https://github.com/JuezUN) project.
- UNCode is a web system for grading programming assignments, used in UNAL.
- Developed automated production-ready deployment tools such as scripts, management and monitoring tools.
- Responsible for the availability of the service.
- Fixed bugs in backend, frontend and infrastructure.
- Involved using Python, JavaScript, MongoDB, Nginx among other tools and languages.
profile_positions.title: Software Development Engineer

profile_positions.description:
- Full Stack Software Engineer, member of the UNCode project.

- Added new features to the existing open source INGInious platform, INGInious is the core of the UNCode system, a web application for grading programming assignments. 

Those new features include 
- Improve ease of use by implementing automatic grading logic generation
- Code smell identification
- Course level and personal statistics
- Improved feedback to the student.

- Involved using Python, JavaScript, MongoDB, among other tools and languages.
profile_positions.title: Software Development Engineer

profile_positions.description:
- Front End Software Engineering intern, member of the Yammer team.
- Yammer is an enterprise oriented social network service part of Office 365 suite.
- Designed, implemented and tested a new feature that allows bulk inviting users from
Office 365 groups to Yammer groups in the web client.
- Involved consuming REST APIs, using React library, Typescript and JavaScript.
profile_positions.title: Software Development Engineer Intern

profile_positions.description:
- Software Engineering Intern, member of the Yammer Backend team.
- Designed, implemented and tested a new user validation logic that only allows Office 365
users to be invited to Yammer.
- Improved the search feature usability by preventing already registered non-Office 365
users from appearing in the search results.
- Designed, implemented and tested a new API that allowed the front-ends to implement
bulk inviting Office 365 groups users to Yammer with one click.
- Involved exposing and consuming REST APIs as well as using Ruby and Ruby on Rails.
profile_positions.title: Software Development Engineer Intern

profile_positions.description:
Teacher assistant in the course of 'Programming Languages'

- Help to guide the students in the use of language development technologies such as Antlr, Xtend.
- Implement, document and give examples of  lexers, parsers and interpreters using Antlr and/or plain Java and C++
- Design subject assignments 
- Solve students doubts

Software and technologies used.
- Java, C++, Antlr, Eclipse, Xtext, Xtend, Domjudge
profile_positions.title: Teacher Assistant

company.name: Microsoft
company.description:
Every company has a mission. What's ours? To empower every person and every organization to achieve more. We believe technology can and should be a force for good and that meaningful innovation contributes to a brighter world in the future and today. Our culture doesn’t just encourage curiosity; it embraces it. Each day we make progress together by showing up as our authentic selves. We show up with a learn-it-all mentality. We show up cheering on others, knowing their success doesn't diminish our own. We show up every day open to learning our own biases, changing our behavior, and inviting in differences. When we show up, we achieve more together. 

Microsoft operates in 190 countries and is made up of more than 220,000 passionate employees worldwide.
